main event: On December 21, 1952, in Los Alamos, New Mexico, a civilian observed a brilliant green, very fast object, initially believed to be a meteorite, with a short tail of flame that then went out.
interesting points: The object appeared suddenly and began to glare up, grew brighter and smaller, then went out.
There was no physical evidence found.
Another sighting in Iran described a green and black object moving with extraordinary speed from west to east and exploding, leaving a great volume of smoke, evaluated as a probable meteor.

Various sightings across different locations, including military and civilian observations, described unidentified flying objects with high speeds and unusual characteristics such as color, luminosity, and maneuvers.

One report mentioned an object traveling at above 1000 M.P.H. with a glowing tail and no sound, leaving no evidence on clouds and disappearing behind a tree, leaving the observer unable to provide more details.
result: prosaic explanation (ASTRO/METEOR) with some sightings remaining unexplained
sighted object: fast, brilliant green object resembling a meteorite
location: Los Alamos, New Mexico and various other locations
witnesses: a mix of civilians and military personnel
photographs: no photographs were included in the report
